trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Pig with .NET in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Pig with .NET in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the .NET SDK for Hadoop to submit Pig jobs to Hadoop on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the .NET SDK for Hadoop to submit Pig jobs to Hadoop on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Run Pig jobs using the .NET SDK for Hadoop in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Run Pig jobs using the .NET SDK for Hadoop in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: This document provides an example of using the .NET SDK for Hadoop to submit Pig jobs to a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This document provides an example of using the .NET SDK for Hadoop to submit Pig jobs to a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that makes it easier to work with HDInsight clusters from .NET.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight .NET SDK provides .NET client libraries that makes it easier to work with HDInsight clusters from .NET.

trans-unit.source: Pig allows you to create MapReduce operations by modeling a series of data transformations.
trans-unit.target: Pig allows you to create MapReduce operations by modeling a series of data transformations.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to use a basic C# application to submit a Pig job to an HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to use a basic C# application to submit a Pig job to an HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Run Pig jobs using the .NET SDK for Hadoop in HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Run Pig jobs using the .NET SDK for Hadoop in HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following.
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following.

trans-unit.source: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (either Windows or Linux-based)
trans-unit.target: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (either Windows or Linux-based)

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2012 or 2013

trans-unit.source: Create a management certificate
trans-unit.target: Create a management certificate

trans-unit.source: To authenticate the application to Azure HDInsight, you must create a self-signed certificate, install it on your development workstation, and also upload it to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: To authenticate the application to Azure HDInsight, you must create a self-signed certificate, install it on your development workstation, and also upload it to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to do this, see [Create a self-signed certificate](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511138).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to do this, see [Create a self-signed certificate](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=511138).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When creating the certificate, be sure to note the friendly name you use, as it will be used later.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When creating the certificate, be sure to note the friendly name you use, as it will be used later.

trans-unit.source: Find your subscription ID
trans-unit.target: Find your subscription ID

trans-unit.source: Each Azure subscription is identified by a GUID value, known as the subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Each Azure subscription is identified by a GUID value, known as the subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to find this value.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to find this value.

trans-unit.source: Visit the [Azure preview portal][preview-portal].
trans-unit.target: Visit the [Azure preview portal][preview-portal].

trans-unit.source: From the bar on the left of the portal, select __BROWSE ALL__, then select __Subscriptions__ from the __Browse__ blade.
trans-unit.target: From the bar on the left of the portal, select __BROWSE ALL__, then select __Subscriptions__ from the __Browse__ blade.

trans-unit.source: In the information presented on the __Subscriptions__ blade, find the subscription you wish to use and note the value in the **Subscription ID** column.
trans-unit.target: In the information presented on the __Subscriptions__ blade, find the subscription you wish to use and note the value in the **Subscription ID** column.

trans-unit.source: Save the subscription ID, as it will be used later.
trans-unit.target: Save the subscription ID, as it will be used later.

trans-unit.source: Create the application
trans-unit.target: Create the application

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio 2012 or 2013
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio 2012 or 2013

trans-unit.source: From the **File** menu, select **New** and then select **Project**.
trans-unit.target: From the **File** menu, select **New** and then select **Project**.

trans-unit.source: For the new project, type or select the following values.
trans-unit.target: For the new project, type or select the following values.

trans-unit.source: Propety
trans-unit.target: Propety

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Category
trans-unit.target: Category

trans-unit.source: Templates/Visual C#/Windows
trans-unit.target: Templates/Visual C#/Windows

trans-unit.source: Template
trans-unit.target: Template

trans-unit.source: Console Application
trans-unit.target: Console Application

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: SubmitPigJob
trans-unit.target: SubmitPigJob

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to create the project.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to create the project.

trans-unit.source: From the **Tools** menu, select **Library Package Manager** or **Nuget Package Manager**, and then select **Package Manager Console**.
trans-unit.target: From the **Tools** menu, select **Library Package Manager** or **Nuget Package Manager**, and then select **Package Manager Console**.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command in the console to install the .NET SDK packages.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command in the console to install the .NET SDK packages.

trans-unit.source: From Solution Explorer, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.
trans-unit.target: From Solution Explorer, double-click **Program.cs** to open it.

trans-unit.source: Replace the existing code with the following.
trans-unit.target: Replace the existing code with the following.

trans-unit.source: Save the file.
trans-unit.target: Save the file.

trans-unit.source: Run the application
trans-unit.target: Run the application

trans-unit.source: Use **F5** to start the application.
trans-unit.target: Use **F5** to start the application.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the **Subscription ID**, the **Certificate friendly name**, and the **HDInsight cluster name**.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the **Subscription ID**, the **Certificate friendly name**, and the **HDInsight cluster name**.

trans-unit.source: The application will produce several lines of information as it runs, ending with something similar to the following.
trans-unit.target: The application will produce several lines of information as it runs, ending with something similar to the following.

trans-unit.source: Press **ENTER** to exit the application.
trans-unit.target: Press **ENTER** to exit the application.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: As you can see, the .NET SDK for Hadoop allows you to create .NET applications that submit Pig jobs to an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, the .NET SDK for Hadoop allows you to create .NET applications that submit Pig jobs to an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
